title: John Mayer, O2, review: Ed Sheeran crossed with Eric Clapton barely covers it
text:
To suggest that John Mayer is the missing link between Paul Simon and Jimi Hendrix might be going too far, but only just. The 41-year old American singer-songwriter has an unusual combination of talents, at once sensitive troubadour and blazing guitar god. Ed Sheeran crossed with Eric Clapton barely covers it.

A big star in the USA, Mayer has won seven Grammy awards, yet they tend to be for things like Best Pop Vocal Performance: his studio albums emphasise melodious songcraft in the vein of James Taylor rather than, say, Slash.

Mayer has a soft, soulful easy-going baritone croon that rises to tender falsetto, gently negotiating ballads about heartache, witty ditties about relationship travails...
